page.title: 16PRINCIPAL BUILDINGS (CONT'D)
page.content: SANDSTONE PLINTH. INSIDE THE HALL STILL RETAINS ORIGINAL TIMBER SAND OAK DOORS.IN THE CELLAR THERE IS THE ORIGINAL COOKING RANGE AND 4 GREAT WATER BOILERS WHICH USED TO PROVIDE HOT WATER. THE PROPERTY HAS 8 ACRES OF GRAZING LAND AND A PADDOCK, OUT-HOUSES AND GARDEN WHICH ADD ANOTHER 1.5 ACRES. THE OWNERS OF THE HALL HAVE THEIR OWN PRIVATE ENTRANCE TO THE CHURCH. {FORTON PARISH CHURCH}IS PARTLY 14 CENTURY GOTHIC IN DESIGN, AND PARTLY GEORGIAN. THE TOWER AT THE WEST END, AND THE NORTH AISLE ARE THE OLDEST PARTS OF THE CHURCH, AND ARE BUILT IN SANDSTONE. THE SOUTH SIDE HAS BEEN REBUILT IN THE GEORGIAN STYLE, AGAIN IN SANDSTONE. THE GEORGIAN WINDOWS ARE HIGH CLASSICAL ARCHES WITH LEADED GLASS AND HAVE A
